questions.question_text: You have configured SSO using a third-party IDP with your Google Workspace domain. An end user has reported that they cannot sign in to Google Workspace after their username was changed in the third-party SSO product. They can sign in to their other internal applications that use SSO, and no other users are experiencing issues signing in. What could be causing the sign-in issue?

choices.B: The message will not be delivered to the end user in any form.
choices.A: The message will be delivered to their spam folder.
choices.C: The user will receive a failure message informing them that the message could not be delivered to their inbox and that they will need to work with their Workspace administrator to resolve the issue.
choices.D: A warning banner will appear on the message informing the user that the message was not sent securely.

questions.question_text: You have configured Secure Transport (TLS) Compliance for all messages coming to and from an external domain, altostrat.com, that your end users communicate with via Gmail. What will your end users experience when messages are delivered to them from altostrat.com without TLS enabled?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The message will not be delivered to the end user in any form.

Selected Answer: B
Incoming messages from non-TLS connections are rejected without any notification to you. The sender gets a non-delivery report.

https://support.google.com/a/answer/2520500?hl=en#zippy=%2Cunderstand-what-happens-to-messages-sent-to-or-from-servers-that-dont-use-tls

Selected Answer: B
B. The message will not be delivered to the end user in any form.

Selected Answer: B
All inbound or outbound messages are rejected when TLS compliance is not met
https://support.google.com/a/answer/2520500?hl=en#zippy=%2Cunderstand-what-happens-to-messages-sent-to-or-from-servers-that-dont-use-tls

Selected Answer: B
B - user will not receive the email as Google will block non TLS compliant emails

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. 
When Secure Transport (TLS) Compliance is configured for messages coming to and from an external domain, such as altostrat.com, Gmail will attempt to enforce TLS encryption for these messages. If a message is sent from altostrat.com without TLS encryption enabled, Gmail will display a warning banner on the message when it is delivered to the end user's inbox. This banner informs the user that the message was not sent securely and may prompt them to exercise caution while interacting with the email.

comments.content:
I was wrong. https://support.google.com/a/answer/2520500?hl=en#zippy=%2Cunderstand-what-happens-to-messages-sent-to-or-from-servers-that-dont-use-tls

Your Secure transports (TLS) compliance setting affects messages sent over non-TLS connections, for addresses and domains that you specify in the setting.

Outgoing messages Messages aren't delivered, and will bounce. You'll get a non-delivery report. Gmail makes only one attempt to send messages over a non-TLS connection.
Incoming messages Incoming messages from non-TLS connections are rejected without any notification to you. The sender gets a non-delivery report.

questions.question_text: Four weeks ago, you exported data from Google Vault and emailed the PST export file to your legal admin. They accidentally deleted the PST file and need it sent again. What steps should you take to re-send the PST file to the legal admin?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Repeat the original search for the original timeframe, and export the data again.

Selected Answer: D
Exports are kept for 15 days only.

Selected Answer: D
D is the most accurate. 
Google Vault will not allow you to re-download data that you have already exported.

comments.content: Yes D but your justification is wrong : you can download exports many times but the files are available only during 2 weeks

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. 
 In this scenario, the legal admin accidentally deleted the PST export file that was emailed to them four weeks ago. To re-send the PST file to the legal admin, you need to repeat the original search in Google Vault for the same timeframe and export the data again.

Selected Answer: D
answer is D

choices.B: Return to the Email Log Search page, and download the PST file again.
choices.A: Return to the Google Vault export page, and download the ZIP file again.
choices.C: Ask the legal admin to return to Google Vault to download the PST file again.
choices.D: Repeat the original search for the original timeframe, and export the data again.

questions.question_text: Your admin quarantine is becoming a burden to manage due to a consistently high influx of messages that match the content compliance rule. Your security team will not allow you to remove or relax this rule, and as a result, you need assistance processing the messages in the quarantine. What is the first step you should take to enable others to help manage the quarantine, while maintaining security?

choices.B: Give the users Services > Gmail > Access Admin Quarantine admin privileges.
choices.D: Give the users Services > Security Center admin privileges.
choices.A: Give the users super admin rights to view the admin quarantine.
choices.C: Configure the admin quarantine to allow end users to release messages.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Give the users Services > Gmail > Access Admin Quarantine admin privileges.

Selected Answer: B

Custom role - Gmail-Access admin Quarantine

Selected Answer: C
C. Configure the admin quarantine to allow end users to release messages.

By configuring the admin quarantine to allow end users to release messages, you are granting users the ability to manage their own quarantined messages without requiring broad admin privileges. This approach adheres to the principle of least privilege because it gives users only the necessary permissions to handle their own quarantined messages while maintaining security.

choices.A: Organize users for each location in separate organizational units (OUs). Add room resources to the corresponding OUs so that meeting rooms would be suggested accordingly.
choices.C: Share each room only with the Dynamic Group defined per each user location so that they can only book the rooms nearby.
choices.B: Organize users for each location in separate Google Groups. Add room resources to the corresponding groups so that meeting rooms would be suggested accordingly.
choices.D: Define users' work locations by setting building ID, floor name, and floor section if applicable as the buildings and rooms are defined.

questions.question_text: Your organization is expected to start using Google Workspace Enterprise Standard in several countries. During the planning phase, the change management leadership team mandates that meeting rooms near each participant's office location should be suggested when someone creates a Google Calendar event, to simplify the user experience and avoid booking rooms when people would not be able to move easily. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Define users' work locations by setting building ID, floor name, and floor section if applicable as the buildings and rooms are defined.
